comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: "President is just 'Tommy' for a day" --New York times story, June 14, 1914: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=F7091FF73C5E13... U. S. President Thomas Woodrow Wilson had declined special recognition during his visit to Princeton, either as President of the U. S., or as former president of Princeton University -- deciding instead that he simply wanted to march around the campus with fellow members of the Princeton Class of 1879, which was observing its 35th anniversary with a reunion during Princeton's commencement week.
